recommendations.recommendation: It`s a well written and intriguing TV serie. I recommend it to the horror fans, because this TV serie has a lot of violence, gore and thriller scenes. Also the imponderable ending make the serie unique.

It was a decent show. The suspense was decent and I was still guessing in the last episode who the culprit was. The lead male character was about as flat and lifeless as possible but the female lead was interesting enough to keep me watching. the music was pretty good and the animation decent.
high school version of final destination for whoever who like moe char not for horror fans who like ghost stuff
Fans of the horror/gore genres will enjoy it. Suspense, interesting characters. Overall a decent watch.

This is a good show. Plenty creepy and atmospheric through the first 5 eps. Many people die throughout, gruesomely, in the manner of horror movies. There`s a neat reveal in Ep 5, and then it gets less scary and turns into a more-traditional "detective" show, eventually culminating in a morally-twisty battle royale spectacle near the end.
this is a good Anime for those who luv a good level of susupence and thriller keeps you in a sense of wonder who is going to be the next victim pls watch it...... its a great Anime

just finished eps. 3, good plot, a bit slow in story development, but still a good story, a bit like Higurashi but concentrate in Rika Furude who can see Hanyu. If u a fan of mistery anime, i guees this would be a good add for your colection.

Very entertaining to say the least, super graphic and suspenseful to say the least but very enjoyable... If your a fan of mystery and dont mind some crazy gore definitely watch. One of the best horror animes i have seen! The ending is wonderful btw :)
One of my fav. anime so fat. real intense suspense anime. you will love this from the 1st ep. to last
Each episode causes a urge to see the next, but I don`t know toward what the show is aiming. Lets see...
decent suspense you can`t call it highschool version of final destination but it is worth watch
This is the best horror anime I`ve seen this year. It was very stable expect some cliches. It drives u in and without knowing you finish 12 episode in one night. Must see for who like horror stuff.

Apart from several minor slips in the storyline it is a really nice written tale with good thought-through mystery an quite a suspense (though it may not seem like it at the beginning). I did not think that there is a possibility to make decent horror serialised, especially in anime that seems not to be best medium for one, but I was wrong. In anime one could presume lots of almost humorous gore, absurdly deformed evildoers etc. but here there is no such thing (well, there is some gore but as a measure not a goal itself). Instead we got aforementioned good storyline together with really good animation with photo-based backgrounds and nicely done characters, which adds the necessary reality feeling. But of course you need to like horror stories not for gore but for the story part to appreciate this series, therefore if you don`t you probably won`t be as moved as I was.
Quite good, though I didnt like the reasoning. But it had some really good cliffhangers. Definitely worth watching

Mix together one spoon of Final Destination, one spoon of Lord of the Flies, and tint of Higurashi, and then you have Another. It`s a mixed bag to say the least. Delivers some good horror and cliffhangers, but the character interactions were strange and the rationale of some of the plot twists didn`t really seem to make much sense. Worth a look.

This one caught me by surprise. It seems to take ideas from several other sources of the same genre, but in the end, it`s really good on its own right. Once you start watching, you won`t be able to stop. Great animation, story and characters.

Young boy arrives to a small town... Despite this start, it`s not "Higurashi" clone. In fact, this anime resembles rather classic of J-horror, like "Ringu" or "Ju-On". Mysterious curse spreads between teenagers, killing them or their families... This anime has only one disadvantage: it`s too short. That`s why we have to read the manga or novel, to reveal the whole mystery. If only this anime was longer, or there was a sequel, faithfully reflecting the manga`s plot, it would be perfect... and I would mark it as "must see" instead of "recommended".

To think i almost dropped this show after 2 Eps... its true, the first two episodes are not really that interesting. But after that you are in for a hell of a ride. I dont mean action or epicness but the sheer madness of what is going on. And seemingly we get more gore every episode. Totally recommended. WARNING: do NOT watch EP7 if you easily catch nightmares.

I highly recommend this Anime because, most Anime just don`t give you the feeling of investment in these characters. I mean there could be a character that you knew in the show for the first few minutes and then the few episodes later he/she dies or maybe in the last episode. This Anime just made me worry about most of the students fates, especially the girls. I don`t know why, but when and if I ever see a girl hurt dying or in a gory situation herself, I feel the need to kill and torture the living **** out of that mother******! Though, I am ok with a guy dying on screen. Either I am crazy or just a weirdo. Anyways, watch this show, I highly freaking recommend it!!!! :)

I had just finished the second episode and I am already wanting more, I enjoy how it is already sucking me in, but I believe that this anime, `Another` reminds me a bit like Higurashi or Elfen Lied, but still my taste. I recommend it for many. ^^

A horror anime classic in my opinion. Got some good gory scenes, lots of with elements with suspense and thrillers. It keeps you guessing from start to finish. If you`re just getting into horror anime then this should be number one on your list. Mind you it starts slow but as soon as things start happening it`s amazing and keeps you on the edge of your seat.

Now this is finally an anime which plays in the same league of Higurashi No Naku Koro Ni.
It is a blast.
it`s really awesome, the mystery, score, and accident some like final destination make me shiver

I think this anime was pretty well made. For a horror anime, it has everything - mysterious characters, unexpected twists and turns, gore and blood - lots and lots of it! It wasn`t predictable, and though it started off slow, it was perfect for setting up the story. All in all, the anime is short and sweet. Really a must see, not just for horror fans, but for everyone who appreciates great storytelling.
I honestly didn`t think this was going to be any good! But it was AMAZING. Great Story, & Twisted Ending. I Recommend it.

Starts off a little slow yes, but that`s not a bad thing either. Because of the little slow story progression, you get to understand the characters, and the story a little, also the story, is one of the best i`ve ever seen, and i must say, it`s a must see, even if you`re not into horror i think you can watch, this since it`s not as scary, as one may think. Amazing go watch nothing more to say.
A tiny bit slow in the beginning (1st 2 eps) but well worth it. Was hooked by the end. You really shouldn`t regret watching this thriller. Isn`t super scary but the suspense is awesome!
Very refined horror with a nice mix of mystery. Good horror series are so rare this is definitely a must see for those who can handle a bit of blood.

My friend started asking about horror/thriller type anime the other day, and the only ones I had seen was the Higurashi series. I know alot of people who like Higurashi, but I really don`t like the way its presented. Then after searching a bit, I found Another. Honestly the best of the genre, in my opinion. It flows very well and it tells a really gripping story. I was questioning what I thought the whole way through. Everyone should see this anime, even if they aren`t fans of the genre. It tells a great plot and has tons of emotions all the way through and the pacing is excellent. I wish more series were like this, and I wish all the "horror" movies in USA could be influenced by this, definitely a chilling experience and the way it should be done.

If you liked Higurashi, you`ll love this. Most of what I watch is light-hearted and even comedic, this was neither and I want to watch it again after finishing the last episode 10 min ago. A fair warning though, some of the sequences may be a bit disturbing like those found in Higurashi. It has a heavy supernatural element to it for those who want to know.

anime.description: * Based on a horror/mystery novel by http://anidb.net/cr27951 [Ayatsuji Yukito], originally serialised in the Yasei Jidai magazine. 26 years ago, in a third-year classroom of a middle school, there was a student named Misaki. As an honours student, also good at sports, the charming guy was popular with his classmates. When he suddenly died, his classmates decided to carry on as if he was still alive until graduation. Then, in the spring of 1998, a boy named http://anidb.net/ch38513 [Sakakibara Kouichi] transfers to that class, and he grows suspicious of the fearful atmosphere in that classroom. In particular, there is a beautiful, aloof girl named http://anidb.net/ch35866 [Misaki Mei] who wears an eyepatch and is always alone drawing pictures.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: amnesia
tag.description: The character suffers from some kind of amnesia (memory disturbance or loss). This may mean inability to memorize new information, or inability to recollect old memories. Since there are many types of memory, the person may e.g. forget who they are but still retain learned skills. Amnesia is fairly common in fiction as a plot device. In fact, because it allows for major plot changes while requiring little creativity from the author, it may be subject to heavy overuse.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: angst
tag.description: A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression. Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing. Etymology: "Angst" is a German word meaning fear or anxiety.

tag.name: horror
tag.description: The horror cinematic genre is characterized by the attempt to make the viewer experience dread, fear, terror, or horror. Often their plots involve the intrusion of an evil force, event or personage, sometimes of supernatural origin, on the mundane world and the consequences thereof.

tag.name: thriller
tag.description: The thriller is a genre of fiction in which tough, resourceful, but essentially ordinary heroes are pitted against villains determined to destroy them, their country, or the stability of the free world. The hero of a typical thriller faces danger alone or in the company of a small band of companions. The protagonist may be a law enforcement agent, a journalist, or a soldier, but typically he or she is cut off from the resources of "their" organization. More often the hero is an ordinary citizen drawn into danger and intrigue by circumstances beyond their control. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: real-world location
tag.description: Places seen in the show exist in reality. Note: This could be sometime in the future, though names and certain places will still be recognizable.

tag.name: parricide
tag.description: Parricide, or the murder of family members, is the act of taking the life of of one or more of one`s own close family members, or even one`s entire family; that may include spouses, parents, grandparents, children, grandchildren, siblings, cousins, uncles, aunts, nephews, and nieces, among others.

tag.name: everybody dies
tag.description: Not necessarily everyone, but a good portion of the characters kick the bucket.

tag.name: unintentional comedy
tag.description: This anime contains certain elements intended to be serious, dramatic, or sad. However, these elements wind up provoking laughter instead.

tag.name: remastered version available
tag.description: This anime has been remastered in a higher quality format than the original release. The remaster may be a simple upscale, or it could be a full enhancement project from the original frames. This is irrespective of whether specific groups have released rips of such formats to the internet.

tag.name: TV censoring
tag.description: The TV version is censored and later DVD/BD releases are uncensored, so the money-grubbing capitalists can make a couple more bucks at our expense.

tag.name: gore
tag.description: A Splatter film or Gore film is a sub-genre of horror film that deliberately focuses on graphic portrayals of gore and graphic violence. These films, through the use of special effects and excessive blood and guts, tend to display an overt interest in the vulnerability of the human body and the theatricality of its mutilation. Due to their willingness to portray images society might consider shocking, splatter films share some ideological grounds with the transgressive art movement. The term "splatter cinema" was coined by George A. Romero to describe his film Dawn of the Dead, though Dawn of the Dead is generally considered by critics to have higher aspirations, such as social commentary, than to be simply exploitative for its own sake. [Source: wiki]

tag.name: detailed landscapes
tag.description: An amazing view of nature, of artificially sculpted landscapes (i.e. gardens), or of a cityscape.

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: sense of foreboding
tag.description: The anime starts off quietly, everything seems to be fine, but from episode to episode the signs that something ominous is about to happen increase. E.g. a typical mystery setting.

tag.name: some weird shit goin` on
tag.description: Scenes of this show point to insanely strange events which seem to be taking place; throughout its episodes, the show may or may not explain what is going on. Either way, many viewers will find that a succinct and accurate way to describe the show is "WTF?", and the show`s explanations (or lack thereof) to the events will often be subject of heated debate.

tag.name: disturbing
tag.description: Watching the show may cause the viewer to have unpleasant feelings.

tag.name: curse
tag.description: A "curse" in this manner depicts an adversity placed upon a person or object by a supernatural power often represented by unique designs and symbols found on the inflicted. While not all curses have negative effects, the majority are meant to remain forever hexing to the receiving victim`s soul. A common portrayal is that which is conjured by an individual that has been caused great suffering and thereby extracts revenge against the accuser in the form of a curse. This abuser will then have their soul spirited away to hell to suffer endlessly for the rest of eternity. In some instances (such as in `Jigoku Shoujo`) the character who extracts revenge also condemns their own soul to Hell upon death.

tag.name: violence censoring
tag.description: Describes TV shows, where parts of the scenes considered as too violent are blackened, blurred, changed to other static screen, or cut out completely. While TV censoring is normally used to boost the BD/DVD sales, this is done under the mantle of being "for the healthy development of youth" or similar excuses. In the long run, it`s just the same. Examples: Deadman Wonderland, Fate/Zero, and Mirai Nikki.

tag.name: massacre
tag.description: Mass murder.

tag.name: slow-paced
tag.description: The story — including its characters and events — develop slowly. May contain a weak continuity of plot and/or character development. Or may be a story telling device to increase the "sense of foreboding" in an anime with thriller or horror setting.

tag.name: rural town
tag.description: The rural town is one that is either isolated from what is considered "normal" society or it is so far away from the city centre that there are not a lot of buildings. Some rural towns do not have the technology of the city (and some want it that way), while others just seem to be behind the times. Most of these towns have some sort of farming culture or inn culture.

tag.name: dark mood
tag.description: Similar to `Dark Atmosphere`, but more focused on the actual characters rather than the setting. A dark mood can easily result from a dark atmosphere. A dark mood is more than just occasionally feeling angry or down, it`s usually a permanent character trait that sours the character`s relationships with others. However it arises, at least one character in this anime can see little good in the world or the people in it.

tag.name: mystery
tag.description: The mystery film is a sub-genre of the more general category of crime film. It focuses on the efforts of the detective, private investigator or amateur sleuth to solve the mysterious circumstances of a crime by means of clues, investigation, and clever deduction. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: adapted into Japanese movie
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a Japanese movie. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Misaki Mei
character.description: A quiet, sullen girl in class 3-B whom Kouichi found was being mysteriously ostracized by the rest of the class. Not knowing the reasons for this he tries to reach out to her, just as a string of mysterious, apparently accidental deaths start to strike his classmates and their families.

character.name: Sakakibara Kouichi
character.description: Sakakibara Kouichi transfers to Yomiyama North Middle School class 3-3 after his father is sent to India to do research work. He stays with his aunt and grandparents in Yomiyama while his father is away. He is afflicted with pneumothorax and is hospitalized right before the beginning of the school year and is at first unaware of the strange goings-on in the class. He meets Misaki Mei at school, and unaware of the reasons for her ostracism by the rest of the class, befriends her despite warnings against doing so, and finds himself at the center of mysterious, apparently accidental deaths affecting his classmates and their families.

character.name: Akazawa Izumi
character.description: Akazawa Izumi is the "head of countermeasures" of Class 3-3, tasked with developing countermeasures to mitigate the calamity affecting the class.

character.name: Sakuragi Yukari
character.description: Sakuragi Yukari is one of the class representatives and a friend of Akazawa Izumi. She dies a bizarre death, tripping on the stairs and stabbing herself in the neck with the sharp tip of her umbrella as she falls. She is apparently the first (actually the second) of the apparently accidental deaths afflicting the class and those close to it.

character.name: Chibiki Tatsuji
character.description: Chibiki Tatsuji was the homeroom teacher of Class 3-3 in 1972, the "first year", when Yomiyama Misaki died. Kouichi`s late mother Ritsuko was also one of his students. He resigned teaching soon after, but remained at Yomiyama North working as the librarian. He has since chronicled the grisly phenomenon afflicting Class 3-3, sharing his findings with Kouichi and Mei.

character.name: Kubodera Shouji
character.description: Kubodera-sensei is the homeroom teacher of class 3-3. In despair after realizing the countermeasures against the deadly phenomenon affecting the class were not working, he murders his bedridden mother and commits suicide in front of the class, stabbing himself with a knife.

character.name: Kirika
character.description: Kirika, whose real name is Misaki Yukiyo, is Mei`s mother. She is the owner of a doll store called "The Hollow Blue Eyes of Yomi at Twilight". She had a stillbirth twelve years ago, which made her obsessed with dolls.

character.name: Sannen Sankumi
character.description: Sannen Sankumi (3rd Grade, Class 3), is one of the classrooms at Yomiyama North Middle School. It is one of the primary settings of Another. 26 years ago, there was a student named Yomiyama Misaki. He was a charming student, good looking and excelled in both academics and sport. All the teachers and students admired him. In his 9th grade, he was placed in class 3. Shortly after entering 9th grade, he died in an accident (there are many theories about this, some saying he died from plane crash and some saying because of fire). Unable to accept his death, his classmates decided to continue acting as if he is alive (talking with his desk, going home with him). Even at graduation, the principal arranged to have his seat included. After graduation, they took a picture of the class and found Misaki, who wasn`t supposed to appear, included, with a pale face, but smiling like everyone else. After that incident, the class has been cursed and placed closer to death. It started in 1973, a year after when they found out about having an extra student and were one desk short. At first they just thought it was an error and ignored it. But six students and ten of their family members died that year. Since then they found out that there is a `dead one` in the class. The `dead one` is the person who died a year or a few years before, but somehow they have been placed in that class (The dead person can be a student or a teacher). All the memories of the people around the `dead person` are altered, so the other students think that he/she is still alive. The dead person also doesn`t realize that they`re already dead. Because of that, at least one student or their family members die each month. This happened because of the countermeasures in Class 3-3 in 1972. The students before have tried many ways to prevent this, including changing the classroom and the class name from class 3-3 to 3-C. However it didn`t work. Until 10 years ago, they found out that in order to prevent the calamity they have `to treat a person as they don`t exist to make up for the presence of the dead person`. In 1998, the class chose to treat Misaki Mei as if she didn`t exist, but the newly transfered student, Sakakibara Kouichi doesn`t know about the class curse and acknowledges her. Because of this, two students and three family members died. After that, the class treats both Mei and Kouichi as they never existed.

character.name: Fujioka Misaki
character.description: Fujioka Misaki is Misaki Mei`s cousin. She died from a kidney disease shortly before the anime begins. She is actually Misaki Mei`s twin sister, Mei having been adopted by her aunt. Though they were raised separately, they occasionally met each other. She was the one Mei was visiting in the morgue when Kouichi first saw her. Misaki`s death is probably the first one which can be attributed to the calamity.

character.name: Mizuno Sanae
character.description: Mizuno Sanae is a nurse at Yuumigaoka Hospital, with a younger brother, Mizuno Takeru, in Class 3-3. She tries to assist Kouichi in unraveling the mystery of Yomiyama North by giving him information she gleans from discussions with her colleagues and her brother. She is killed when the elevator she was riding drops down the shaft, with the ceiling crushing her. She is one of the "Deaths of June".

character.name: Numata Mineko
character.description: Numata Mineko is Ikuo Takabayashi`s grandmother and janitor at the inn the class is lodging. A gentle warm-hearted grandmother, though she proved to be an insane crone murderer.

character.name: Matsui Aki
character.description: Matsui Aki is a student of 9th Grade Class 3 in 1998, attendance number 23. She is good friends with Kanaki Anzu. One of the eight "Deaths of August" killed by Kazami`s blade after she met Kouichi.

character.name: Mizuno Takeru
character.description: Mizuno Takeru is a member of 9th Grade Class 3, attendance number 25, and a student at Yomiyama North Middle School. He is a basketball club member.

character.name: Etou Yuu
character.description: Etou Yuu is a student of 9 Grade Class 3 in 1998, attendance number 4. She does not participate during the camp in August.

character.name: Ogura Atsushi
character.description: Ogura Atsushi is Yumi`s brother and a hikikomori. He was killed when an excavator crashed into his house.

character.name: Kaneki Kyouko
character.description: Kaneki Kyouko is a student of 9 Grade Class 3 in 1998, attendance number 9. She sits in classroom in front of Takako Sugiura and is seen to be a good friend of Matsui Aki. She is one of the eight "Deaths of August", being killed by Kazami Tomohiko when she was trying to escape with Matsui.

character.name: Tatara Megumi
character.description: Tatara Megumi is a student of 9 Grade Class 3 in 1998, attendance number 14. She does not participate during the camp in August.

character.name: Nakajima Sachiko
character.description: Nakajima Sachiko is a student of 9 Grade Class 3 in 1998, attendance number 20. She does not participate during the camp in August.

character.name: Yonemura Shigeki
character.description: Yonemura Shigeki is a member of 9th Grade Class 3 in 199, attendance number 27. He does not participate during the camp in August.

character.name: Numata Kensaku
character.description: Numata Kensaku is Takabayashi Ikuo`s grandfather and janitor at the inn the class is lodging. He is the first one to be murdered by his wife Keiko on the night of the camp`s first day.

character.name: Fujimaki Naomi
character.description: Fujimaki Naomi is a student in 9 Grade Class 3 in 1998, attendance number 21. She does not participate during the camp in August.

episode.title: Rough sketch -素描-
Rough Sketch
Esquisse
Rascunho!
Rough Sketch: Sobyou
episode.summary: Kouichi Sakakibara moves in with his grandparents in Yomiyama due to his father`s job, but is soon hospitalized with a collapsed lung. When he joins the 9th grade`s class 3 at Yomiyama North Middle School a month late, he is drawn to a girl with an eyepatch, Mei Misaki, whom he had coincidentally met in the hospital. Her mysterious air intrigues him, but though his classmates give him a warm welcome, none of them seem willing to acknowledge her... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Blueprint -思惑-
Blueprint
Intention
Planta!
Blueprint: Omowaku
episode.summary: Fascinated Kouichi speaks to Mei whenever he sees her, but she never answers his questions and only responds with words of caution such as "You should be careful." His classmates can`t hide their bewilderment at Kouichi`s behavior. Still, wanting to know more, he decides to follow Mei after school. When he ends up in a certain residential area that evening, there he finds... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Bone work -骨組-
Bone Work
Ossements
Bone Work: Honegumi
episode.summary: When Kouichi meets Mei in a studio full of old dolls, she tells him the story of a 9th grade class 3 student`s mysterious death 26 years ago, but Kouichi`s classmates only clam up when he asks them for more information. His aunt Reiko then tells him that his late mother was in that same class 26 years ago.. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Build limbs -拡散-
Build Limbs
Diffusion
Build Limbs: Kakusan
episode.summary: After Mizuno`s tragic accident, the tension in class 3 escalates, and Akazawa is chosen as the new female class officer without Kouichi`s knowledge. His classmates have been discussing something behind his back, but nobody will tell him why. Takabayashi doesn`t agree with the methods taken by the class, so he offers to answer Kouichi`s questions, but then... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Put flesh -輪郭-
Put Flesh
Contour
Put Flesh: Rinkaku
episode.summary: The credibility of the "class 3 curse" rumor shoots higher with a student`s sudden, accidental death, and Kouichi can`t help thinking that Mei is somehow connected to the events of 26 years ago. Though Mei has noticed the change in the class, she still won`t give Kouichi further details on what`s going on. Class 3 seems terrified of something, putting Akazawa, the head of countermeasures, in a difficult spot... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Face to face -二人-
Face to Face
Face à face - Tous les deux
Face to Face: Futari
episode.summary: Class 3 has been enacting a charm for the past 26 years to counteract the "calamity." This was the reason behind everything that seemed odd to Kouichi since he joined the class. Kouichi accepts the circumstances of the charm, though he thinks it`s unreasonable, and begins to spend more time with Mei. He also sets out investigating Yomiyama North`s history in the school library... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Stand by oneself -死者-
Stand By Oneself
Faire face - Le Mort
Stand By Oneself: Shisha
episode.summary: Panic ensues at the lodge as desperate students seek the key to stopping the class 3 calamity once and for all. Can Kouichi and his friends find the solution before the death count rises again? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Makeup -惨劇-
Makeup
Mise en scène - Accident tragique
Makeup: Sangeki
episode.summary: Matsunaga`s tape has at last revealed the measures necessary to stop the calamity once it has begun. Kouichi, Mei, Teshigawara, and Mochizuki try to think of a way to bring class 3`s continuing tragedies to an end, but when the tape falls into the wrong hands... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Glass eye -漆黒-
Glass Eye
Œil de verre - Noir de jais
Glass Eye: Shikkoku
episode.summary: Kouichi and his friends found the tape Matsunaga left in the old school building, but the casualty count continued to rise. So class 3, led by Ms. Mikami and Chibiki, begin their class trip, where Kouichi, Mei, and Teshigawara meet in Mochizuki`s room to listen to the rest of Matsunaga`s tape. Through it Matsunaga tells them what he did to stop the calamity... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Body paint -連鎖-
Body Paint
Peinture corporelle - Enchaînement
Body Paint: Rensa
episode.summary: The unrest surrounding class 3 has multiplied since the unexpected accident that happened outside Yomiyama. After hearing Matsunaga murmur "...in the classroom" after the accident, Kouichi decides to search the former class 3 homeroom in the old school building. He only asks for help from Teshigawara and Mochizuki to avoid involving anyone else, but Mei joins in after finding them in the old building, and the four of them begin their investigation... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Hair stand -紺碧-
Hair Stand
Coupe de cheveux - Glauque
Hair Stand: Konpeki
episode.summary: Kouichi and his classmates set off in Reiko`s car to meet her former classmate Matsunaga, the man who holds a clue to stopping the calamity, at the resort hotel where he works. As they spend the day at the beach awaiting his arrival, they run into Mei, who`s staying nearby at her family`s summer home. They all enjoy their freedom from the anxiety of being stuck in Yomiyama until... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Sphere joint -変調-
Sphere Joint
Sphère réunie - Altération
Sphere Joint: Henchou
episode.summary: When blood flows in the class 3 homeroom, the students realize that the calamity has not stopped. The "charm" is called off, and the students begin to wonder who among them is actually dead. Meanwhile Kouichi learns that, 15 years ago, the calamity started but then stopped in the course of the year. The librarian Chibiki tells him that class 3 had visited Yomiyama Shrine on a class trip during summer break that year... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プレミアム先行上映イベント
Premium Advance Screening Event
Premium Senkou Jouei Event
